intro: Jussiaea nervosa stirps stricta, commonly known as the narrow-veined jussiaea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for water gardens and bog landscapes.
